eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu

Class GuildApplicationMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.GuildApplicationMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class GuildApplicationMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Sub menu of the guild menu, that is used for viewing and managing guild applications.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    GuildOverviewMenu

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuildApplicationMenu

        public GuildApplicationMenu()

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Shows a list of guild applicants, only viewable by guild officers or higher. Lists up to 27 applicants (3 inventory rows), including last online time and character stats. The officer can decide which application to accept by left or right clicking them.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        See Also:
        GuildOverviewMenu.validateOfficerAccess(Player, WauzPlayerGuild), WauzPlayerGuild.getApplicantUuidStrings(), PlayerConfigurator.getLastPlayed(OfflinePlayer), PlayerConfigurator.getRaceString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getWorldString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getLevelString(OfflinePlayer, int), PlayerConfigurator.getSurvivalScore(OfflinePlayer), MenuUtils.setBorders(Inventory)

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. Cancels the event and accepts or rejects the clicked application. The application has to be boï¿½nd to a valid player and the guild must have free slots, to accept them. A right click rejects the application, while a left click will accept the player into the guild. The menu is updated after each processed application.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.getGuild(OfflinePlayer), WauzPlayerGuild.removeApplicant(String), WauzPlayerGuild.addPlayer(OfflinePlayer)
